title: user permissions / read only user
body:
feature request:
--------------------------------
in order to use owncloud as a "review & approve" platform for customers, it would be nessasary to add some features to owncloud. here is my proposal for that scenario:

solution no.1
--------------------
one cloud space should be accessible for more than one user: the owner and additional guests. the "owner" should be able to add guest users for his own cloud space, whereas those guests users (the reviewers) should only be able to see files in the given folder structure (files and folders uploaded and managed only by the owner of that space).

those reviewers should not be able to:
create / upload files or folders, share, access or editing own profile (including password!).

it would be cool if they could leave a comment on reviewed files without editing the files themselves (mainly videos or images).

solution no.2
--------------------
as described above, but discard the "multiple user per space" (owner + guests) action and replace "owner" with group admin, and "guest / reviewer" with a normal oc user where the group admin is able to restrict those users to the above described permissions.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
why sharing does not apply in this scenario:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
files and folders shared via password protected link are not presented in a very convenient way. also there is a security / privacy issue because the user can not actively log out and close the session.

files and folders shared via shared folder require the review users to have a normal owncloud account, where they can access their personal profile and e.g. change the login credentials and password or access / edit used apps. this should be prevented because one guest account should be used by more than one person and the look & feel of the cloud space should only be controlled by the person who manages / administrates the space. in my proposed solution this would be the owner of the specific space.
